page.title: 03Fordoun Village (contd)
page.content: A second smiddy more a workshop now stands at the end of the village and across the road is a new eninering workshed which among other things makes containers for oil rigs. The village hall, built in memory of those who died in the first world war stands beside the big park and second smiddy. On the way to sprinbank Terrace stands a house which was built as a temperance hotel. At a lower level is the aage where a cattle mart used to operate. The terrace itself was named after 2 blocks of each of 4 houses built early this century. Most of the houses in the new part of the village were built by the council or Scottish Special Housing Association.
